sen.j: 初代 瀬川如皐（しょだい せがわ じょこう、元文4年（1739年） - 寛政6年1月23日 (旧暦)（1794年2月22日））は江戸時代中期に活躍した歌舞伎作者。
sen.e: Joko SEGAWA the first (1739 - February 22, 1794) was a Kabuki actor during the middle of the Edo period.
Joko SEGAWA the first (1739 - February 22, 1794) was a Kabuki playwright during the middle of the Edo period.
Joko SEGAWA the first (1739 - February 22, 1794) was a Kabuki playwright during the middle of the Edo period.

sen.j: 俳名に如考・如皐、雅号に東園がある。
sen.e: His 'Haimyo' (kabuki actor's offstage name which can be used officially and privately) were 如考 and 如皐 (both pronounced "Joko"), and his Gago (pseudonym) 東園.
sen.cmt: 「如考・如皐」読みが一緒なので漢字表記が有ります。「東園」の読み方不明。
sen.e: His Haimyo (kabuki actor's offstage name which can be used officially and privately) was 如考 or 如皐 (both pronounced 'Joko'), and his Gago (pen name) was Toen.
sen.cmt: were -> was東園の読みは「とうえん」としましたが、確認できる資料は見つかりませんでした。
sen.e: His Haimyo (kabuki actor's offstage name which can be used officially and privately) was 如考 or 如皐 (both pronounced 'Joko'), and his Gago (pen name) was Toen.

sen.j: 大坂の日本舞踊・市山流の初世市山七十郎の子。
sen.e: He was a child of Nasoro ICHIYAMA the first, a dancer of the Ichiyama school which was a school of classical Japanese dance in Osaka.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処

He was a older brother to Kikunojo SEGAWA the third.

sen.j: 最初は歌舞伎役者で市山七蔵を名乗る。
sen.e: As a Kabuki actor, he called himself Shichizo ICHIYAMA at first.
Originally he called himself Shichizo ICHIYAMA as a Kabuki actor.
sen.cmt: 英文を書き換えました。
sen.e: Originally he called himself Shichizo ICHIYAMA as a Kabuki actor.

sen.j: 明和4年 (1767) に江戸に下り、瀬川菊之丞 (2代目)の門下で瀬川七蔵に改名した。
sen.e: In 1767, he went to Edo to become a disciple of Kikunojo SEGAWA (the second) and changed his name to Shichizo SEGAWA.

sen.j: その後再度、市山七蔵、瀬川乙女等と改名。
sen.e: Then he changed his name to Shichizo ICHIYAMA again, and to 乙女 SEGAWA.
Then he renamed himself to Shichizo ICHIYAMA, and to Otome SEGAWA.
sen.cmt: changed his name -> renamed himself 乙女の読みは「おとめ」としましたが、確認できる資料は見つかりませんでした。
sen.e: Then he renamed himself to Shichizo ICHIYAMA, and to Otome SEGAWA.

sen.j: 天明3年 (1783) に作家に転じて瀬川如皐を名乗る。
sen.e: In 1783, he shifted to writing, under the name of Joko SEGAWA.
In 1783, he changed his career to writing; Joko SEGAWA.
sen.cmt: 英文を書き換えました。

sen.j: 翌年11月に立作者になり櫻田治助 (初代)に次ぐ人気を得る。
sen.e: In November 1784, he became Tatesakusha (the head of the playwrights' room in a Kabuki theater during the Edo and Meiji period), and gained the second highest popularity after Jisuke SAKURADA the first.

In December 1784, he became Tatesakusha (the head of the playwrights' room in a Kabuki theater during the Edo and the Meiji period), and gained the second highest popularity after Jisuke SAKURADA the first.

sen.e: In December 1784, he became Tatesakusha (the head of the playwrights' room in a Kabuki theater during the Edo and the Meiji period), and gained the second highest popularity after Jisuke SAKURADA the first.

sen.j: 弟・三代目菊之丞に多くの演目を各傍ら、歌舞伎舞踊の作詞も手がけた。
sen.e: He wrote many programs for his younger brother, Kikunojo the third,while working on the lyrics of Kabuki Buyo (Kabuki dance, a traditional form of Japanese theater).
sen.cmt: 原文「各」を「書く」として訳しています。一原文一訳文の例外対処。

sen.j: 長唄『狂乱雲井袖』、常磐津『四天王大江山入』などを残した。
sen.e: He wrote Nagauta (long epic song with shamisen accompaniment) "Kyoran Kumoi-no-sode" and Tokiwazu (a performance of Joruri [the Japanese-type puppet play]) "Shitenno Oeyamari".
